meanings.definition: To mix a solid substance with a liquid until it forms a solution.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys dissolving sugar in her tea every morning.
meanings.sent2: The salt is slowly dissolving in the water.
meanings.sent3: The sugar cube was dissolving so slowly, it seemed like a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: His anger seemed to be dissolving away with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the paint were dissolving into a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To disappear or break apart into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent1: The clouds were dissolving in the sky as the sun rose.
meanings.sent2: The tablet was dissolving quickly in the water.
meanings.sent3: The mystery was dissolving before their eyes, revealing the surprising truth.
meanings.sent4: Her fears were dissolving like mist in the morning sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sandcastle was dissolving back into the beach, carried away by the tide.
